content:
• Thursday, June 11, 2015
  • CABO

    Graham Holdings spinoff Cable One starts when-issued trading

    • Cable One stock began when-issued trading today under the symbol CABO, ahead of its spinoff from Graham Holdings (GHC +1.4%), working between $405 and $400 before closing at $399.84.
    • That's about 36.9% of the share price for parent Graham Holdings, closing today at $1,085.
    • On July 1, Graham shareholders of record June 15 will receive a share of Cable One stock for every Class A and Class B GHC share they hold, via a tax-free transaction. There will be a $550M debt offering along with the spinoff to pay a special dividend. Graham has just under 5M shares outstanding.
    • In Graham's Q1 earnings report, cable revenues of $198.7M made up 23.5% of its total revenues of $846.1M.
    • Previously: Graham Holdings details timing of Cable One spinoff (Jun. 04 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 PM
  • BOBE

    Bob Evans to consider sales-leaseback, REIT conversion for properties

    • Bob Evans Farms (NASDAQ:BOBE) +3.6% AH after saying it will consider sales-leaseback or tax-free REIT conversions and spinoff of its restaurant properties, affecting 30%-60% of its currently owned real estate.
    • CFO  Mark Hood says BOBE’s new plan will help it maintain the flexibility to pursue a separation of foods and restaurant segments in the future, if necessary, as well as “reduce its investment in lower-return assets."
    • BOBE says it is still assessing which route it wants to take, which could depend on factors such as general economic conditions and market values for restaurant real estate.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:10 PM
  • TWTR

    Dorsey says Twitter's strategy won't change; shares now +2%

    • "I do not forsee any changes in strategy or direction," says chairman/interim CEO Jack Dorsey (NYSE:TWTR) on a CC regarding Dick Costolo's resignation. No word yet on how Chris Sacca feels about this.
    • Dorsey promises Twitter will vet both internal and external candidates during its CEO search, and says the company is looking for a candidate who "uses and loves the product in every single way."
    • CNBC reports Costolo wasn't forced out, and decided on his own to step down. He won't be receiving a severance package.
    • Twitter has pared its AH gains. Shares are now at $36.55.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM | 34 Comments
  • DISH

    WSJ: Dish talking to banks about up to $15B in cash for T-Mobile deal

    • Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) is talking to banks about funding a bid to acquire T-Mobile (NASDAQ:TMUS), to the tune of $10B-$15B in borrowing for the cash part of the deal, The Wall Street Journal is reporting.
    • T-Mobile is up 3.6% after hours; Dish is up 1.7%.
    • The deal's in early stages, but as discussed, the stock portion would leave T-Mobile parent Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY) with a significant minority stake in the combo.
    • No word on how much Dish would pay for T-Mobile, but talking with banks shows it's moving forward.
    • In the previous discussions, one key issue already seems sorted out among the personality-laden leaders: Dish CEO Charlie Ergen would serve as chairman, while T-Mobile's John Legere would be CEO.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 12 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: PMCS +5.1%. BOBE +3.6%. MOMO +3.4%. EXXI +2.4%. DISH +1.7%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TOUR -2.2%. ACHN -2.0%. MPEL -1.5%.BRKR -1.1%.DSKY -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 3 Comments
  • LF

    LeapFrog -16.3% on FQ4 miss, downbeat FY16 outlook

    • "We expect fiscal year 2016 sales to contract considerably relative to the prior year, and operating losses for fiscal year 2016 to be similar to or greater than fiscal year 2015 losses, excluding goodwill and long-lived asset impairments," says LeapFrog (NYSE:LF) in its FQ4 report. The FY16 (ends March '16) consensus is currently for revenue to rise 4% Y/Y to $351.9M, and EPS to improve to -$0.41 from FY15's -$1.08.
    • The children's tablet/electronic toy maker blames its FQ4 performance on "high carry-forward retail inventories from the holidays, lower demand for our tablets and associated content and the later than planned shipment and promotion of LeapTV."
    • The company states its turnaround plan centers around "the diversification of the LeapFrog brand into new children's product categories, the stabilization and broadening of our current product lines and the growth of content share of our business, including the distribution of our award-winning content beyond our hardware base to other platforms."
    • Financials: GAAP gross margin fell to just 10.3% from 37.1% a year ago. Excluding a $36.5M impairment charge, operating expenses rose 6% Y/Y to $42.3M. LeapFrog ended Q1 with $127.2M in cash, and no debt.
    • Shares have plunged to $1.73 AH, making new 52-week lows in the process.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM | 8 Comments
  • CDTI

    Clean Diesel reaches new supply agreement with Honda

    • Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI) +8.6% AH after disclosing that Honda North America (NYSE:HMC) agreed to purchase goods and related services from the company; financial terms are not disclosed.
    • CDTI says the agreement continues its relationship with HMC, and updates and replaces its existing supply agreement from 2000.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • FRO

    Frontline files for $100M mixed shelf, 55M-share offering for sellers

    • Frontline (NYSE:FRO) -1.8% AH after filing for a $100M mixed securities shelf offering and a 55M ordinary share offering by selling shareholders.
    • FRO will receive no proceeds from the sale of securities by any selling shareholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 19 Comments
  • XONE

    ExOne down 9.2% after missing revenue, earnings in delayed report

    • ExOne (NASDAQ:XONE) is down 9.2% in postmarket trade after posting its delayed Q1 report where it missed on top and bottom lines amid negative effects from exchange rates.
    • The company had delayed its Q1 report, originally due May 11, which it attributed to problems with implementing an ERP system set to improve financial controls.
    • The quarter was "unfavorably impacted by the mix of sales including the level of machine sales in the quarter, compounded by higher fixed costs and inefficiencies associated with the Company's new and expanded production facilities" -- which it said included implementation expense around the ERP implementation.
    • Revenue by line: 3D printing machines, $1.1M (down 54%); non-machine, $5.7M (up 16.3%). Of total revenues, non-machine now makes up 84%.
    • It's reaffirming full-year expectations, with revenue expected to grow 32-50%, to $58M-$66M (on the high side of an expected $59.8M), gross margin between 36-40% and capex of $5M-$7M.
    • Conference call tomorrow at 8:30 a.m.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 6 Comments
  • RH

    Double-digit revenue growth for Restoration Hardware

    • Restoration Hardware (NYSE:RH) reports comparable brand revenue increased 15% in FQ1.
    • Direct revenue was up 18% during the quarter.
    • Adjusted operating margin rate +60 bps to 4.4%.
    • Full-year guidance: Revenue of $2.146B-$2.176B expected vs. $2.17B consensus and EPS of $3.02-$3.15 vs. $3.04 consensus.
    • Previously: Restoration Hardware beats by $0.03, beats on revenue
    • Shares of RH level in after-hours trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • TWTR

    Twitter CEO Costolo resigning; shares +7%

    • Costolo will remain on the board, and Dorsey will remain Square's CEO while serving as Twitter's interim CEO.
    • Twitter has used the announcement to affirm its Q2 revenue and adjusted EBITDA guidance. Separately, the company announces it's removing its 140-character limit for direct messages; the limit is now at 10K.
    • Twitter has jumped to $38.34 in AH trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 35 Comments
  • RH

    Restoration Hardware beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Restoration Hardware (NYSE:RH): FQ1 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $422.44M (+15.3% Y/Y) beats by $3.47M.
    • Shares +5.24%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • REXX

    Rex Energy reports positive initial results of first two Moraine East wells

    • Rex Energy (REXX -6.1%) is sharply lower despite announcing positive initial testing results in the Moraine East area that show its Renick 2H well produced 6.6M cfe of natural gas over a 24-hour period while its Renick 3H well reached 8.8M cf/day.
    • Rex says it expects the Renick pad to be placed into sales at the end of 2015 in conjunction with MarkWest Energy Partners.
    • In presentation slides yesterday, Rex said it sees Q2 production of 199M-205 Mcfe/day, FY 2015 production of 193M-203M cfe/day, and FY 2015 capex of $135M-$145M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • WIN

    Windstream up 2.7%, debuts more cloud offerings

    • Windstream Holdings (NASDAQ:WIN) is among key industry gainers today, up 2.7%, as it rolls out yet more product offerings in its Hosted Solutions area.
    • Yesterday the company introduced its Elastic Hybrid Cloud offering to add burst agility to private cloud customers, as well as launching a Platform-as-a-Service solution called Docker to its public cloud customers.
    • Today the company is rolling out a Cloud to Cloud Recovery solution to add to disaster recovery measures. The hardware-free offering uses Zerto software to replicate private cloud data into one of the company's cloud data centers.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 3 Comments
  • AGNC

    Beaten-down mREITs draw some buying interest

    • Interest rates retreating from near-one-year highs are helping, but the sector is looking very cheap as investors anticipate falling book values and/or slashed dividends.
    • American Capital Agency (AGNC +1.9%) - prior to today's action - was trading at a 21.9% discount to May 31 book value and yielding 12.31%.
    • Previously: American Capital Agency discount to book value widens (June 10)
    • CYS Investments (CYS +1.4%) cut its dividend by 6.7% earlier this week, and is trading at a 17.9% discount to March 31 book.
    • Annaly Capital (NLY +1.3%) hasn't yet declared its Q2 dividend, but is trading at a 22.5% discount to March 31 book.
    • ETFs: MORL, REM, MORT, LMBS
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 44 Comments
  • TUBE

    TubeMogul down 7.2% after offering CEO calls 'big win'

    • Unsurprisingly, TubeMogul (NASDAQ:TUBE) is lower (down 7.2%) following its pricing of a 5.3M-share follow-on offering. The offer price of $15.75/share was 4.6% below yesterday's closing price of $16.51.
    • CEO Brett Wilson is upbeat, though: "It's hard to look at this as anything but a big win for us and our shareholders," he tells Business Insider.
    • He notes it is signaling the market about an orderly transfer of venture capital-funded shares back to the market, in a time when VC funding is starting to dry up for advertising technology.
    • "We're not a company that is bleeding cash and needed to raise. We are exactly the opposite," Wilson says. In its most recent report, TubeMogul logged $36.9M in total cash against just under $1M in debt.
    • Of the offering financing, $55M will go to the company while $27.9M will be returned to stockholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • AVG

    AVG +5.4%; JMP ups target, sees Zen driving upside

    • JMP's Patrick Walravens has hiked his AVG target by $14 to $47, while arguing the company's Zen cross-device security software/service platform acting as a growth driver.
    • Walravens: "We expect AVG to begin to monetize Zen using a subscription model and think it could drive upside to the financial model. About eight months ago, AVG began to apply the Zen user interface to each new download, now the key is to monetize it based on certain triggers, such as the number of devices covered. A key milestone in this process will be the completion of a subscription billing engine that AVG has been working on and which may be complete in 3Q15."
    • He forecasts 20% and 15% 2016 and 2017 revenue growth, above consensus estimates of 16% and 10%, and believes competition is limited following Symantec's efforts to de-emphasize its consumer security ops. Walravens also notes the Location Labs acquisition expands AVG's reach with international mobile carriers.
    • Shares have made fresh 52-week highs. They're up 40% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo -2.5%; Capstone calls IRS Alibaba spinoff approval unlikely

    • After talking with tax lawyers and lobbyists, policy analysis/research firm Capstone thinks recent comments from an IRS official about potentially changing tax-free spinoff rules were "carefully choreographed" by the IRS and Treasury, and "designed to send a message to Yahoo (YHOO) concerning the Alibaba spinoff, though neither company was mentioned by name."
    • Capstone thinks an adverse ruling would have an $11B impact on Yahoo, whose 384M-share Alibaba stake is currently worth $33.7B. It also notes (citing a law firm) the aggregate value of all spinoffs occurring in 2012 and 2013 was respectively just $41B and $33B.
    • Yahoo tumbled on May 19 after an IRS official stated the agency is reviewing rules on "spinoffs of trades or businesses that are small compared with a company’s other assets," but recovered a chunk of its losses after responding to the comments.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 33 Comments
  • ESV

    Offshore drillers broadly lower as Barclays goes negative

    • Barclays rolls out coverage of offshore drillers (NYSEARCA:OIH) with a negative outlook, saying "the worst has yet to pass" as customers deal with the low oil price environment and a heavily oversupplied offshore rig market.
    • While the stocks likely would rally with higher oil prices (and short covering), fewer rigs then would be retired on the hope of demand improving, preventing the necessary catharsis the industry needs, the firm says, adding that based on its rig-based distributable cash flow valuation methodology, the group's risk/reward profile is not attractive.
    • The firm starts shares of Ensco (ESV -3.1%), Rowan Companies (RDC -3.1%), Atwood Oceanics (ATW -5.7%) and Pacific Drilling (PACD -2.7%) with Equal Weight ratings, and Transocean (RIG -5%), Diamond Offshore (DO -4.4%), Noble Corp. (NE -3.9%) and Ocean Rig UDW (ORIG -6.4%) with Underweight ratings, the firm's sell rating equivalent.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 50 Comments

  • Treasurys add to gains after strong 30-year auction

    • With investors enticed by sharply higher yields/lower prices, the Treasury concludes a strong week of auctions, selling $13B in 30-year bonds priced to yield 3.138%.
    • The bid-to-cover ratio of 2.54 was the highest since December, and indirect bidders took down 52% of the sale, the most in nearly a year. Dealers bought 33.6% and direct bidders 14.4%.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is now lower by eight basis points on the session to 2.40%. TLT +1.9%
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, TLH, SBND, VGLT, UBT, DLBS, TLO, TENZ, LBND, DLBL, TYBS, VUSTX
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM | 4 Comments
  • SHOP

    Shopify up 4.6% in wake of Facebook deal

    • Shopify (NYSE:SHOP) is posting big gains a day after announcing Facebook's Buy button news feed posts and ads would be available to merchants using Shopify's e-commerce software/services platform.
    • The feature is initially available to certain U.S. merchants on an invite-only basis, but will be expanded in time. Shopify is providing tools for posting Buy button ads, tracking their performance, and managing related orders.
    • Shares are up 73% from May's $17 IPO price, and a more modest 5% from a post-IPO opening trade of $28.00.
    • Prior Shopify coverage, IPO analysis
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: RGSE +30%. ATLC +30%. PBIB +19%. DRAM +17%. PUB +16%. DEST +15%. JRJC +14%. INUV +13%. VIMC +12%. NPD +11%.
    • Losers: MBLX -17%. TRCH -16%. GALT -11%. SIEB -11%. TNXP -10%. MHR -10%. AST -10%. BV-OLD -9%. CBLI -8%. TANH -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • MARA

    Jury rules against Marathon partner; shares -32.5%

    • A Delaware jury has ruled against tire maker Bridgestone in its infringement suit against Schrader-Bridgeport International. Marathon (NASDAQ:MARA) had "advised [Bridgestone] and provided substantially all of the financing of this litigation," and owns "contract rights to the revenue associated with the outcome of this case."
    • Marathon CEO Doug Croxall: "We are clearly disappointed by the jury's ruling. It is a decision Bridgestone will promptly appeal as we believe the jury erred in their verdict. This outcome has no bearing on our German case and we remain confident in the validity and infringement of our European patent ... Marathon has invested in a diversified portfolio consisting of 413 patents across 19 different subsidiaries, 12 of which are in active litigation with approximately 50 defendants."
    • Shares had plunged on the verdict before Marathon put out a PR. They remain at their lowest levels since 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • SU

    Alberta should raise carbon price but slowly, Suncor CEO says

    • Suncor Energy (SU -2.2%) CEO Steve Williams says he supports a higher carbon tax for Alberta as long as the rate is increased gradually to ensure Canada’s oil remains competitive with other places.
    • The current price of C$15/metric ton (US$12) that is applied to large industrial emitters "wasn’t a bad place to start and I think it can move on” with increases over time, Williams tells Bloomberg.
    • A price for carbon that increases over time will provide oil companies with the long-term certainty they need, especially with oil sands projects that run for decades, the CEO says.
    • Alberta was one of the first places in the developed world to implement a carbon tax in 2007, but Premier Notley’s new government has said it will roll out new regulations, including a possible change to the price of carbon, by the end of this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 11 Comments
  • MBLY

    Mobileye +4.4%; Wells ups target, sees major software opportunity

    • 3 weeks after Citi hiked its Mobileye (NYSE:MBLY) target following meetings with CFO Ofer Maharshak and business development chief Yonah Lloyd, Wells Fargo has upped its valuation range to $56-$60 from $51-$54 after hosting investor meetings for the two.
    • Wells left the meetings more bullish about Mobileye's software potential. "As automotive OEMs embrace software, we believe Mobileye has an opportunity to increase content more frequently ... Currently, the bulk of consumers would have to buy a new vehicle to get access to new Mobileye features. However, as OEMs enable over the air (OTA) updates, we believe MBLY and others ... may be positioned to realize content gains on vehicles in operation."
    • The firm adds Tesla (with Mobileye's help) is currently the only automaker supporting OTA driver-assistance system updates. "[T]here are about 6M vehicles currently equipped with MBLY technology. Not all can be updated, but we believe the revenue opportunity could be meaningful in the out years."
    • The new valuation range is equal to a steep 50.5x-54.1x Wells' 2017 EPS estimate of $1.11. Mobileye is adding to the Tuesday gains seen after the NTSB recommended making collision-avoidance systems standard on new U.S. vehicles.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 8 Comments
  • GPT

    Gramercy Property talks Life Time Fitness purchase on conference call

    • Previously owning zero assets in "specialty retail," Gramercy Property Trust (GPT +1.1%) will now own 10 properties, making up 12% of total contactual base rent. Gramercy, however, expects to sell up to four Life Time Fitness facilities by year-end, leaving it with six properties, making up 6.9% of contractual base rent.
    • As that level Life Time would be Gramercy's 2nd-largest tenant (by base rent), trailing Bank of America at 19.6%. Life Time is a B2 credit, according to Moody's versus A2 for BofA, and Ba2 for  #3 tenant NSN, to name a couple.
    • Webcast and presentation slides
    • Gramercy's purchase/leaseback comes as part of the LBO of Life Time in which the company's buyers are unloading about $900M of the fitness center operator's real estate.
    • Previously: Gramercy Property closes $300M deal, boosts outlook and dividend (June 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • COMM

    CommScope drops after Carlyle unloads 20M shares

    • Former CommScope (NASDAQ:COMM) P-E owner Carlyle is selling 20M shares via JPMorgan. The offering was priced this morning at $30.80, 5% below Wednesday's closing price.
    • The sale covers over 10% of CommScope's outstanding shares. Once it's over, Carlyle will own a 32% stake.
    • Update: CommScope closed down 3.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • ORAN

    Orange CEO, Netanyahu to meet Friday about Israel remarks

    • Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will meet Friday with Orange (ORAN +1.7%) CEO Stephane Richard to discuss the controversy over Richard's remarks about pulling out of the country, an official says. Richard has arrived in Israel.
    • Richard shook up the country last week with comments in Cairo about leaving Israel "tomorrow" if it weren't for penalty risk. He apologized and plans emerged this week for him to visit Israel to discuss the matter.
    • Richard maintains his move to sever the relationship with Israel's Partner Communications (NASDAQ:PTNR) is not related to a French boycott movement and is merely related to brand licensing.
    • Partner sells services under Orange's brand, and Orange maintains a few other units in Israel (Orange Business Services and Internet TV specialist Viaccess-Orca).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 3 Comments
  • MARA

    Marathon -33.3% on huge volume (updated)

    • Marathon Patent (NASDAQ:MARA) has cratered on volume of 1.54M shares, far above a 3-month daily average of 105K.
    • No news has hit the wires yet, but drops of this magnitude for IP licensing firms are typically due to legal setbacks ... of which there have been many for the group over the last year.
    • Update: A jury ruling in an infringement suit by Marathon partner Bridgestone was the culprit.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • VLO

    Valero is top refinery pick at Goldman Sachs, EOG also a Conviction Buy

    • Valero Energy (VLO +3.2%) and EOG Resources (EOG -0.1%) are maintained with Conviction List Buy ratings at Goldman Sachs, which says higher shale productivity and oil demand are likely to support the performance of the refinery sector.
    • Although the firm is neutral on the refiner group after its YTD outperformance, it considers the sector as poised to benefit from higher global product demand growth and improved capture rates from lower oil prices.
    • Goldman considers VLO the top pick among refiners, citing the company's focus on reducing capex and returning capital to shareholders, strong Gulf Coast product cracks, and an attractive valuation.
    • The firm's six-month price target for VLO is $74, while its 12-month target for EOG is $113.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 5 Comments
  • NBGGY

    Greek deal not yet near as IMF team returns to D.C.

    • "We are well away from an agreement," says IMF spokesman Gerry Rice, as the agency's technical team returns to D.C. from Brussels. "There are major differences between us in most key areas and there has been no progress in narrowing these differences."
    • The main obstacles, says Rice, are pension reform, tax policy, and financing. "On financing, what we have said consistently is that is has to add up."
    • Nicely higher earlier, the Greek ETF (GREK -0.1) turns red, as does National Bank of Greece (NBG -0.8%).
    • Previously: S&P further downgrades Greece (June 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 54 Comments
  • AAPL

    Criteo -5.6%; Apple plans to support ad-blockers on Mobile Safari

    • "The new Safari release brings Content Blocking Safari Extensions to iOS. Content Blocking gives your extensions a fast and efficient way to block cookies, images, resources, pop-ups, and other content," writes Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) in its developer documentation for iOS 9 (launching this fall).
    • StatCounter estimates Safari had a 24.9% global mobile/tablet browsing share in May, trailing only Google Chrome's 30.8% ... and Safari's share of the high-income consumers beloved by advertisers is likely larger, given Apple's customer demographics.
    • Content publishers aren't thrilled with Apple's plans to support 3rd-party ad-blockers. NiemanLab's Joshua Benton: "Publishers already make tiny dollars on mobile, even as their readers have shifted there in huge numbers ... If iOS users — the majority of mobile web users in the U.S., and disproportionately appealing demographically — can suddenly block all your ads with a simple free download, where is the growth going to come from?"
    • Benton also notes Apple's support for cookie-blocking could prevent content paywalls from working. At the same time, he admits "bandwidth and performance and battery life are all at a premium" on mobile, and that many ads act as a big resource drain.
    • Criteo (NASDAQ:CRTO), whose e-commerce ad platform relies on cookies to deliver retargeted ads to users on PC and mobile sites, is selling off (hat tip: Marc Lehman). Other ad tech plays don't appear to be affected much by the news for now. Apple's move follows remarks by Tim Cook arguing Apple places a greater value on consumer privacy and data protection than Google and other rivals. Android already supports ad-blockers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 26 Comments
  • HMIN

    Home Inns & Hotels Management details go-private offer

    • Home Inns & Hotels Management (NASDAQ:HMIN) announces it received a go-private offer at $32.81 per U.S. ADR from a buyers group which includes BTG Hotels, Victory Investments, Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP), and the company's Co-Chairman of the Board. and a group of
    • The buyers group already collectively owns 35% of the shares.
    • HMIN +4.10% to $31.41.
    • English version of Home Inns PR
    • Previously: Trading halted on Home Inns & Hotels Management
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • INXN

    InterXion up 2.4% as Oppenheimer upgrades; Baker directors resign

    • InterXion (NYSE:INXN) is up 2.4% in early action after noting that the Baker Capital representatives on its board have resigned, as a result of an 18.6M share distribution by Baker's affiliates, and Oppenheimer has upgraded shares to Outperform.
    • Chairman John Baker and Rob Manning submitted resignations this week. The company has appointed Jean F.H.P. Mandeville as the new chairman and will look to fill the vacancies.
    • Oppenheimer's price target for the shares is $32; InterXion is currently trading at $28.86.
    • Previously: In merger's wake, InterXion confirms end to its Telecity agreement (May. 29 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • CTXS

    Citrix +8.1%; activist calls for asset sales, cost cuts, larger buybacks

    • Elliott Management, which has taken activist positions in many tech stocks over the years, has disclosed a 7.1% stake in Citrix (NASDAQ:CTXS), and is calling for a series of moves it asserts "can achieve a stock price of $90-$100+ per share by the end of 2016."
    • Among them: 1) Streamlining the company's sales/marketing ops, cutting R&D spend, and selling or realigning "non-core" products such as CloudBridge, CloudPlatform, and ByteMobile. 2) Pursuing a sale or spinoff of Citrix's GoTo product line (covers collaboration, remote PC access, and IT service management software), and exploring "strategic alternatives" for the NetScaler application delivery controller hardware/software line.
    • Elliott also wants Citrix to raise debt to create $4.3B-$5.3B in buyback capacity through 2017 ($125M was spent on buybacks in Q1), and take steps to reverse recent talent drain.
    • In many respects, the Citrix turnaround proposal is similar to the one Elliott floated for Juniper in early 2014; the firm would up getting most of what it wanted. MKM and Mizuho argued in April Citrix could become an activist target.
    • Shares have jumped to $71.31 premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 1 Comment

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: CJJD +16%. ATOS +15%. BOX +13%. PTBI +11%. MW +8%. CTXS +8%. ISIS +8%.
    • Losers: FOLD -7%. OTC:DSKX -4%. COMM -6%. GLP -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM
  • ABEO

    Roth Capital starts PlasmaTech Bio with Buy rating and $16 PT; shares up 11% premarket

    • Micro cap PlasmaTech Biopharmaceuticals (PTBI) is up 11% premarket on robust volume in apparent response to Roth Capital's initiation of coverage with a Buy rating and $16 (108% upside) price target.
    • Shares skyrocketed in early May after investors learned that hedge fund star George Soros established a stake in the company.
    • Previously: PlasmaTech Bio up 43% premarket on Soros stake (May 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM

  • Europe drives Treasury yields lower

    • One might expect long-term U.S. Treasury yields to take  out new 2015 highs after the strong May retail sales report provides more evidence of a nice Q2 bounce in economic growth.
    • The 10-year yield, however, is lower by four basis points to 2.44% as yields across the pond tumble. After hitting 1.03% earlier in the session, the German 10-year Bund yield has slipped all the way back to 0.90%, off eight basis points for the day.
    • The Italian 10-year yield is down 13 bps to 2.13%, and the 10-year yield is lower by a full 20 bps in Spain to 2.12%.
    • TLT +0.95%, TBT -1.9% premarket
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TMF, EU, TTT, ZROZ, TLH, SBND, VGLT, UBT, DLBS, TLO, BUNL, TENZ, LBND, BUNT, GGOV, DLBL, TYBS, VUSTX
     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 2 Comments

  • DEST

    More on Destination Maternity's Q1

    • Destination Maternity (NASDAQ:DEST) reports comparable sales fell 1.1% in Q1.
    • Gross margin rate declined 400 bps to 50.4%.
    • SG&A expense rate increased 20 bps to 45.2%.
    • Total retail location count -35 Y/Y to 1,868.
    • FY2015 Guidance: Comparable sales: increase in the low single digits; Gross margin rate: increase slightly Y/Y; Capex: ~$25M.
